page.title: 14FARMING AROUND CRUDWELL
page.content: {Most of the farmers in this area grow {crops}on their land although they also keep{some sheep and beef cattle.}The main crops grown are{wheat and barley, followed by oil-seed rape and potatoes.This year,1985,a few farms are also growing peas for animal food. {The other major land use is growing {grass for hay or silage.}In the summer months many tractors are on the roads moving heavy loads.All the farmers find their tractors very useful.The farms in this area vary in size from about 100 acres to about 700 acres.The largest fields are about 50 acres. {Most of the farms have a house on the {farm}and are run by the family who live there.21 children out of the 124 children who attend Crudwell Village School live on farms.
